page.title: 09ECCLES CHURCH
page.content: The Methodist Chapel is used by Methodists and C.E. on a communal basis.St Marks Church no longer exists,the site is occupied by two bunalows.St Marks Infant School closely allied to Aylesford St Peters occupies land in Eccles Row.An anonymous donation of Â£100 started funds for the building in 1931.Lack of a village hall means constant use of the church schoolroom by Playgroup,Sisterhood,Lunch Club,Sunday School,Youth Club & Polling Station. Built by Burrows the Builder the chapel foundation stone was laid by Miss Greenfield's, a local resident,grandfather.Greenfield Close a road commemorates the families community service over the years.A congregation of approx 20 worships at the chapel every Sunday except festivals when attendance is higher
